website_summaries.verdict: Good results for a dog toothpaste with such a low price per ounce. Works well for reducing plaque and tartar on dog's teeth.
pros: Works great for dogs with sensitive gums and mouths
All natural ingredients included in the toothpaste recipe
Available in a convenient squeeze tube
cons: Sticky texture of toothpaste may cause a mess
Some owners report their dogs hated the taste and wouldn't use it

customer_reviews.title: Neem Oil
customer_reviews.text: If I had known that Neem oil was in this product I wouldn't have purchased it. Neem Oil which I've used as a insecticide in my yard has made some dogs sick when ingested or used on skin and therefore I take no chances with such ingredients, which although a useful natural substance on its own has had some deadly affects. My sweeties are too dear to me to take the chance so I am throwing out this product. The toothbrush design is ridiculously useless so also gets tossed.
customer_reviews.author: singer

customer_reviews.title: Fonzie Approved
customer_reviews.text: Must be good tasting because our senior rescue who never had brushing likes it.
customer_reviews.author: 3 Chihuahuas :)

customer_reviews.title: Teeth went from nasty to nice.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about using the dental gel . But after trying this for about 30 days I can't believe the difference . I have a 14 year old whippet rescue and his teeth were horrible . The tartar has broken up and come off of his teeth with my fingernails it's amazing how well this works . You have to be persistent and use it daily or even twice a day but it will do the trick .
customer_reviews.author: Baxter Katz

customer_reviews.title: Tooth saver!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product saved our Yorkies remaining 7 teeth. She was 8 years old when we started using it every single day. She had already lost all of her teeth but those 7. I had used other products prior to finding this one, I'm so thankful to have found it. Our Yorkie lived until she was 17 without loosing one more tooth. I also love the fact that it's natural. I want to send my gratitude to all those that created this product and only wish you all could find a product that would keep our best friends alive for double their normal life expectancy. We miss our little pumpkin!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: After one time use I can see a difference in my dog's teeth. She doesn't like to chew hard dental bones so it's a struggle to keep her teeth clean.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: My poor adopted dog came to us with a mouthful of ...
customer_reviews.text: My poor adopted dog came to us with a mouthful of problems. This doesn't reverse the bad that already existed, but it makes the bad manageable. The formula is soothing to her irritated teeth and gums, helps eliminate tartar build up for easier cleaning, and has significantly improved her bad breath.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: LOVE! I have two springers whos teeth were getting ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! I have two springers whos teeth were getting bad- to the point where I was about to pay big $$ to get them done at dentist - I started using this and brushing their teeth every other day - oh snap this works magic - most of their plaque is gone already!! Great price and nice size bottle, I thought that it would be too small but I have been using it a lot already and still have a ton in the bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My pup LOVES the flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lots of reviews on different brands and decided on this one. GREAT IDEA! There is no bad odor, if anything, it's odorless. My dog loves the flavor of it too - he actually sits when he sees me getting the toothpaste out because he thinks it's a treat. We just started using it two weeks ago and have already noticed an improved on some build up on his back teeth. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki_D

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!!! Dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: Y’all avoid this toothpaste like the plague. I just spent over $400 at the vet for emergency treatment of my dog. This toothpaste, used once with a very tiny amount, made my dog sick for over three days. Vomiting and diarrhea constantly for three days. Do you and your dogs a favor, do not buy this at all!!!! It is dangerous at best, possibly deadly at worst.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Martin

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! I ordered this item and reviewed the ingredients/made in information as soon as it arrived. Two BIG problems: 1) The toothpaste contains baking soda, which means it's not dog safe. If you're comfortable using it anyway, go for it... But I don't see a good reason to use a risky toothpaste on my pup when there are many baking soda free options out there. 2) IT'S NOT MADE IN THE USA. The toothpaste is made in the US, which is probably why they can get away with the false advertising, but the toothbrush is made in China (per the packaging). Sad because this would've been a good find, but after reading the package, it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: roemily

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been sick for two days straight after brushing his teeth with this product..He has had terrible poops and on top of that has been puking..I would advise people to be cautious when purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Ankita Heath

customer_reviews.title: Upset Dog's Stomach
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a sensitive stomach and this product made it very upset. I tried it a couple of times and it made her throw up each time. Very Disappointed. Also - the tooth brush is way to big for my 15 pound dog.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Powell

customer_reviews.title: that's GREAT. The toothbrush works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: My dog tolerates this toothpaste, so in my book, that's GREAT. The toothbrush works pretty well, and is nice. The 1 star off is because while the toothbrush does get a lot of areas around the teeth, it can't get at all spots, and is not stiff enough to take off brown stains or plaque (not a 'perfect' product, but excellent). Compared to most dog toothbrush and paste combos, the fact that the dog won't fight and bite you trying to brush his teeth makes this worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Old AliceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Update: worst dog paste ever. Not only is the brush useless but now our dog that loved having his teeth brushed runs away. Product says it was developed by a vet! Maybe one that failed vet school. The shape of brush makes no sense at all. All that happens is the plastic on both sides grinds at your dogs teeth’s and the bristles never make it on tooth! Please go and buy a human tooth brush. Toothpaste smells like glue!
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: Effective dental gel
customer_reviews.text: I've been using and testing this gel out on my dogs for several months and it's doing a very nice job with keeping their teeth clean. I also like that the price point is very reasonable. However, I do think they need to find a softer squeeze bottle, or maybe create a pump top. The bottle is really hard to work with. What I had to do was use a pump from another product that I had bought, and used up, and this solved my issue with trying to get the product out.
customer_reviews.author: goldens

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My labby loves her teeth brushed. Every night when I brush my teeth she runs in and watches patiently. I ran out of her toothepaste months ago and just stopped, because I am nervous of the ingredients I find in them all. After much research, this is the most natural. No harmful ingredients like glucose, dog spit doesn't break it down like us human. or even much worse formaldahyde #moretoxic believe or not i have been noticing is in some common dog paste brands? My dog loves the taste btw, light vanilla scent.
customer_reviews.author: Sunkissedsunkist

customer_reviews.title: love the new packaging
customer_reviews.text: love the new packaging!! We had a bottle of the old packaging dental gel from vet's best and it was so hard to squeeze out the product so i was happy to see they updated the packaging to a toothpaste like tube. Our pup loves this toothpaste and he doesnt mind us brushing his teeth with it. It smells minty and gets rid of his horrific bad breath! People (including our vet) always ask us what we do to keep his teeth looking so white and healthy and this is it!
customer_reviews.author: PatTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: NOPE- Use it as leather conditioner
customer_reviews.text: Used on my dog twice about three days apart. Both times she seemed to become ill. Just not herself. So, I looked up Neem's oil and found it was a leather conditioner. Soon after, bought an antique desk with leather surface. Tried it on the desktop and it worked great at reconditioning the leather. Labeled it 'Not For Pet Use' and put it away with my cleaning supplies. Am disappointed. So many people said it worked great on their dog, but I suspect she was having a reaction to one of the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Tashinamu8

customer_reviews.title: My dog seems to like it...
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time, my dog runs away from toothpaste. It's been really hard to find one that she likes. She seems to respond well to this one. As far as I can tell, this toothpaste does not have artificial sweeteners in it, which is also why I haven't had luck with other toothpastes. They trigger seizures in my dog. The only questionable ingredient is the baking soda, which dogs are not supposed to have (in large doses). I haven't noticed any negative side affects though. Overall, I notice her breath smells better after use.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Kormaniak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent natural ingredients for tartar removal
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by the natural ingredients of neem and grapefruit seed extract, which is exactly what I used to put in my handmade dental paste. Not the tastiest for the dogs so I sneak it in between a dab of poultry flavor paste to start and finish. I put some on their teeth before the bath and then another brush after drying them and you can literally see a change in the tartar. I've no doubt that if the clients used it daily at home their dog's teeth would be clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa YoungTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Contains Neem Oil - A Known Insecticide - Makes My Dog Sick Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I FINALLY figured out why my dog rushes out to eat grass some mornings, and not once, but repeatedly over the course of the whole morning. I thought it was feeding her too much at night. It's not that at all, it's this toxic toothpaste with neem oil. Why a product like this is made is beyond me. Neem oil is used in organic gardens as an insecticide. Why would you ever give this to your dog? I feel so sorry I've made my dog sick many times because of this awful product. It should be banned.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: very few and recognizable natural ingredients. much better value then c.e.t toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how small the ingredients list is, and they are all recognizable natural stuff. I recently threw out some white chalky dog toothpaste that I couldn't verify has being made in the US. I started researching the ingredients one by one and gave me a scare. Hate to throw things away, but not chancing it with scary chemicals. This toothpaste includes the enzymatic stuff, so it satisfies my requirements. I like the c.e.t toothpastes very much, but they are very expensive
customer_reviews.author: EthicalConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: So this is a gel toothpaste which didn't really matter to me. However, my dog did not like the taste. I introduced it with a dab on my finger & he turned away. This is a dog that eats trash & cat poop! His dislike for the taste made it that much harder to brush his teeth. The smell of the paste itself is gross, it smelled awful out of the tube. A positive is that it did do a good job of leaving his teeth clean but I will definitely be looking for a new product that we both like.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C.

customer_reviews.title: Made her sick
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a very sensitive stomach and is on a strict regime of prescription food. I used this toothpaste twice and she had diarrhea both times. The first time it happened, it didn’t register with me but after the second time I realized what the cause was. In the trash and back to petrodex.
customer_reviews.author: rosegardener

customer_reviews.title: Not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: We have used CET toothpaste for years with just a regular Human toothbrush. I have tried brushes from the vet, finger brushes, teeth cleaning chews, treats and teeth cleaning toys. So.... I thought we would give this a try. Our Dogs don’t seem to mind the toothpaste but it’s not as flavorful as the CET. The toothbrush, which is why I bought this kit, was a joke. It didn’t fit between any of my 3 dogs teeth. I guess it’s just for tiny dogs with lil teeth? I went back to the good ole human tooth brushes.
customer_reviews.author: aaron fortin

customer_reviews.title: Smells like Ky Jelly
customer_reviews.text: Stinks like "personal lubricant". IDK if it does a good job of cleaning the dog's teeth or not. I think most of the cleaning of teeth occurs with the brushing part of it anyway so probably does not make too much difference. I was using another brand that at least one of our dogs loved the taste of previously, and that made things easier. With this one, none of our dogs like the taste and I find the smell sort of gross. I'll finish this tube but go back to the other one next time. It may be a good toothpaste for dogs, but having them like the taste is important too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N Mikulaninec

customer_reviews.title: Vet's Best Enzymatic Dental Gel Toothpaste for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: First time I ever used a dog toothpaste. The grapefruit flavor gel is agreeable with my 7# Yorkie girl. She lets me brush her teeth with no problem of running away. I have already purchased a second tube.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho NanaAnnie

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: my Japanese hate.....hate I mean really hate when I brush their teeth, I have sprays, gels, spent lots of money of dental treats. I have been using this, a little trick I do before its their bedtime I now put a dab of this toothpaste on their dental treat. its works and they love it plain or with the dental treat. I recommend this toothpaste plus it is made in USA/Texas, NOT CHINA like other toothpaste PLEASE EVERYONE READ THE LABEL WHEN IT COMES TO YOUR PET. ITS NOT JUST TREAT AND DOG FOOD BUT IT CAN BE TOOTHPAST ALSO. YOU ARE SLOWLY KILLING YOUR PET WITH ANYTHING MADE IN CHINA!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for something to brush my dogs teeth with that is made in USA and natural. Thought I had found it but THIS GAVE MY TWO DOGS HORRIBLE DIARRHEA after ONE BRUSHING!! One of my dogs was so lethargic and unwell for three days. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: ABOMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Meh..unsure how I feel about this
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. Not impressed by any means. After my puppy was diagnosed with pancreatitis I had to switch her to canned food which in turn caused tartar build up and bad breath. This does (sort of) freshen her breath and I haven't noticed a difference in tartar reduction. This doesn't have a fresh mint scent or tea tree oil smell or even a meat smell, weirdly it smells kind if like glue. I got this because of the price, and the good ratings. They don't seem to mind the taste but I'm not that impressed with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: I love the toothbrushes more than the toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: Smell is just okay but the puppers seem to like the flavour well enough. I love the toothbrush it comes with though! One of my two is a bit of a chewer and she is messing it up a bit but the brush just makes it soo easy to brush both of my dogs teeth, a small-medium 30lb one and a medium-large 60lb one. Not sure if I'll buy this flavour toothpaste again but will definitely buy the toothbrushes again.
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to get into a routine with her for sometime. This one works, not only does it smell nice she likes it. According the the labeling it's banana flavored, who knew? At any rate, it does seem to be helping with her breathe. Unfortunately the brush was a bust. It's far too large for her mouth, and she's a large boxer. Side point. I saw a couple comments about the Neem oil being dangerous because it's used into pesticides. They use it in pesticides because it's not dangerous to animals. It's an animal safe alternative. Just an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: RollinggirlTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog a seizure
customer_reviews.text: I disregarded the few other 1 star reviews on here for this product about safety because I thought they were crazy but they were right: after using this toothpaste my poor dog had a seizure and difficulty breathing... do NOT use! I don’t understand how this has not already been removed from the market for safety reasons. Amazon, please discontinue selling this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Terrible toothbrush design
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is super awkward to actually brush your animals teeth. Because there’s no angle of the wand and the bristles are on each side of the tooth it doesn’t work well. I accidentally made my poor dogs gums bled in one spot. Don’t get fancy with this and use a regular toothbrush. My dog also hates the taste, and she doesn’t mind other flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES the taste of this toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: My 12yr old Westie, does NOT like me brushing her teeth, but since I found this, and put it on her brush, she tries licking it off, and I can get her brushing done, as she actually LIKES the taste!! I'm THRILLED!! Really helpful in the process!!
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Does the job great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the toothpaste on my dogs almost everyday and let me tell you. THERE IS A DIFFERENCE. My 8 (almost 9) year old chihuahua mixed dog, she has really bad teeth because she is a rescue but it makes her gums stop being so red. Now they're pink and has taken out the inflammation and her other teeth that aren't so bad, are white. I have 2 other dogs so I also brush their teeth and let me tell you. Their teeth are sparkling white! Thank you. I was really skeptical about this. No lie!
customer_reviews.author: Leonor

customer_reviews.title: Wow, the best.
customer_reviews.text: I have used CET and Nylabone in the past. Did not like either and they did not seem to change my dogs breath. This tooth brush really works and the formula is amazing. My 11 year old Boston Terrier is moderately cooperative with brushing, but just getting the tooth gel in her mouth leaves her breath fresh for 24 hours. !st week I used it she had some very mild bleeding from the brushing, but after 1 week it is gone and the gums seem much healthier. She does get her teeth cleaned at the Vet periodically, so she does not have terrible problems-just older doggie breath, which is now gone. Yeah.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Lisa H.

customer_reviews.title: Too small & too awkward
customer_reviews.text: I have to rate this product a 2. I would give it a 1, however my dog loves the taste of the toothpaste. It appeared to be a great idea for the toothbrush, but it doesn’t fit onto the canine teeth whatsoever. It’s a waste of money to buy the set because the finger brush is extremely tight & doesn’t fit my finger. I have small hands and it was difficult to push it even halfway down. I’m going to purchase a traditional doggie toothbrush. It’s not a total waste of money and we are entitled to differences of opinion but u sometimes have to stick with the basics.
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Best K9 Toothpaste I've Found
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different brands of doggie toothpaste, and this is be best I have found for two reasons. First, I don't have to use as much as other brands because this is a gel and stays on the brush better. This makes it the most cost-effective toothpaste I've found. Second, it foams up just the right amount to provide full coverage without making a mess. My dog seems pretty neutral on the flavor. She doesn't love it like some of the other brands I've tried, but she doesn't seem to dislike it either. I'm not using it for a treat, and the fact that she doesn't try to lick it off the brush actually makes brushing easier.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Kennington

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...did not get the results I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: Even though this product had good reviews, I did not like. Or should I say my dog did not like the flavor I think because she just refuses to let me brush her teeth. Also, the toothbrush is big for her mouth and it is hard to her teeth aligned right between the three angles of the brush. She won't even let me get in her mouth. :( So, in other words, this was a total waste of money for me. My dog is a bichon frise (22 lbs). She is fine when I brush her teeth with a regular brush and another toothpaste brand. So I am going back to basics.
customer_reviews.author: zenny216

customer_reviews.title: Terrible smell, should be named "Vet's Worst".
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Sentry Petrodex for quite awhile and my dog loves it, but Amazon's subscription system wasn't working properly so I couldn't get my regular delivery moved up and Amazon stopped answering phone calls, so I tried this brand, "Vet's Best". My dog took a whiff and turned away each time. After the third attempt he just quickly walked away. I took a whiff and it smells like a mix of diesel fuel and super glue. If it smells that bad to a human, imagine how bad it would smell to a dog with a much more powerful sense of smell.
customer_reviews.author: topgun44

customer_reviews.title: Read the end about price drops!!!
customer_reviews.text: So it is a good product but the toothpaste isn’t minty and it a weird thick gel that my dog wasn’t too fond of at first. The toothbrush is really cool through in the way it gets to all sides of his teeth quickly! Also the price on this product fluctuated drastically in 2 days when I was deciding to buy it or not. So I added it to my honey watch list and the price dropped $4 in one day!!!! Then the next day it went back up?!?!? This kinda angers me. Still a good product but watch it to check for price drops. Don’t pay more than $8 for this. I’ve seen it go as low at $5.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Parker

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog feel awful the next morning.
customer_reviews.text: This package arrived yesterday and I tried it that night. I used just a little bitty dot to just try it. This morning my dogs stomach sounds like it's going to explode. There is no other explanation on to why his tummy would hurt. Now I feel awful. Thanks. This was a complete wasn't of money..
customer_reviews.author: Anna Passmore

customer_reviews.title: No More "Dog Breath"
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely will not let me brush his teeth with a toothbrush. This is the perfect alternative! I apply this twice a week and have had great results. Bentley's teeth look great and his doesn't have the same "dog breath" he used to.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Cape

customer_reviews.title: Fresh breath!
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund is getting up there in age, and we’ve noticed her breath getting smellier and smellier. She absolutely refuses to chew on anything that claims to be breath-freshening or tooth-cleaning (the only things she refuses to chew on, really) so that led us to our last resort: brushing her teeth. She, admittedly, does not handle this well, but I think it’s more of the fact that she’s a little jerk (re: dachshund) than that the stuff doesn’t taste good. I do have to say, I see noticeable improvements in her breath, and with a dog that loves to give kisses, that’s an A+ in our book.
customer_reviews.author: pdevlin24

customer_reviews.title: Two types of brushes and gel!
customer_reviews.text: This comes with finger toothbrush and an interesting three headed toothbrush. My dogs are easygoing but it does take some time to get these three headed toothbrush over the back teeth to brush and can be a little aggressive for some dogs( you can make their gums bleed) ... you really have to get your fingers in their mouth . I’m hoping this helps her horrible breath since she doesn’t have much tartar . No smell to toothpaste and she doesn’t seem to mind the taste . Interesting design - Some may find the finger toothbrush more useful
customer_reviews.author: K. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a while on my husky and have noticed improvements with the quality of his breath and health of his teeth. The mint flavor is bonus compared to some other "meat" flavored toothpastes and the dog loves it. Toothbrush is easy to use and does not bother the dog. Even the vet has mentioned the quality of his teeth and gums from using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Made my Golden Retriever very sick...
customer_reviews.text: My Golden Retriever was trusting enough for me to try brushing her teeth for the first time this weekend. And, of course, I used this toothpaste which made her very sick. She has become lethargic, has diarrhea, and has thrown up multiple times. She has a cast iron stomach and does NOT get sick so this is very alarming. If she is not better tomorrow I will be heading to the vet. Any treatment and the associated costs will be forwarded to Vet's Best for reimbursement. Luckily, I have a product liability attorney in my family and will exercise that option if needed. Bottom line: Avoid this product or be prepared to manage the consequences.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Von

customer_reviews.title: Great Canine Toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a toothpaste for your dog that isn't filled with sugars (or other bizarre and/or unpronounceable ingredients) your search can stop here. Just a few simple ingredients, it doesn't contain nuts (important if your family has allergies), and seems mostly odorless. My dog's teeth are cleaner than ever, and regular use seems to be removing some plaque that was forming. My dog doesn't mind it at all - she's pretty tolerant, but she comes right over when called for "tooth brushing time" so it must be neutral or possibly pleasant. I've put this on auto-ship as I am not going back to any prior product I've ever used. This is it!
customer_reviews.author: hari sharma

customer_reviews.title: Love so far!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve only used it a couple times but I noticed immediately it helped with her breath! Even my parents noticed. She hates getting her teeth brushed but she loves the flavor, so if she doesn’t let me scrub her teeth much I just give her a small amount to lick. I do not like the tooth brush. It’s difficult to use but the fact my dog hates her teeth being brushed doesn’t help in using it. I rather the finger brush, much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Brush is difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The tooth paste/gel included is great but the brush is difficult to use. The concept is great, the brush could ideally cover both sides of the dog’s teeth, but in reality it’s difficult to get the brush in the dog’s mouth at the right angle to make it work. My dog is pretty good about sitting still but even with that, it was hard to use. I normally like their products so I was bummed this didn’t work that well. I’ll still buy their other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah King

customer_reviews.title: Weird smell that my dogs don't like
customer_reviews.text: This product works just as described but I wish the flavor and or scent was a little more dog friendly. It seems like it has a minty smell and my dogs just don't like it as much as some other pastes or gels that I've tried. It's not as easy to get the job done with it having an off putting taste. My dogs will not even lick it when I try to give them a bit for freshening their breath. So I'm on the lookout for a better product. I've also heard that Neem oil is toxic so I don't think that I will be using it on my babies.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Caution
customer_reviews.text: My dog had intestinal distress for 2-3 days after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Harvell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply with fingers, cleared bad breath and she loves the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for our (new rescue) 3 year old terrier mix, Zsa Zsa. The vet said she had signs of build up on her teeth. We were pleased to find out that the label indicated you could apply with fingers. Zsa Zsa loves the flavor and wants to lick it off my fingers, (or straight from the tube) and we found it easy to apply. It has cleared up her bad breath, which was worth it on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: dora

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this with the intention of brushing our dogs teeth. I assumed the flavor would be something he would be interested in, possibly attracted to. He wouldn’t lick the toothpaste off of my finger, he sniffed it and walked away. The toothbrush design is more complicated than a human toothbrush and it’s not an intuitive design. I followed the directions on the package, watched videos online and ultimately failed. I think we may have more success with a dog friendly flavored toothpaste that I have seen other brands offer. This one is non-specific other than mentioning the use of “neem oil”.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: My puppy doesn't mind the brush or the toothpaste.
customer_reviews.text: After buying another brand that my 7 month old puppy literally run from, I'm so glad I tried this brand. He's still a puppy so I have a hard time brushing his teeth, but I put some toothpaste on the toothbrush and he'll just start chewing. I have to hold the toothbrush for him and face it up and down but he seems to like chewing on the brush with toothpaste. If I put too much toothpaste, he'll just lick it so I put a little and rub it into the bristles. For us, this was the only thing that would help his stinky breath.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Toothbrushing is an ongoing struggle and I hoped ...
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush bristles are so tight that one would have to have that brush placed exactly right to brush. with my dog shaking his head and trying to back away, I couldn't get even one tooth cleaned. Very disappointed. Toothbrushing is an ongoing struggle and I hoped that this would work, but it needs to have more space between the sets of bristles so we don't have to work so hard to get it on a tooth. I don't know if that would work, but this does not.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Bevins

customer_reviews.title: Made dog Sick! Repeatedly!
customer_reviews.text: It made dog sick multiple times, which required vet visit and medication to remedy ongoing GI upset (diarrhea, vomiting). Wish I never tried this! It was offered at special price as an add on item. As a result, dog paid dearly with feeling ill and so did I. Aside from that more important point, the clear and runny consistency is awful and makes it hard to stay on brush.
customer_reviews.author: OC buyer

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is in the round shape surrounding the tooth and I was impressed when I saw the toothbrush, my dogs Teeth were black, I put a lot of toothpaste on the brush hoping for enzymatic action and I brushed his teeth and I kept on putting more toothpaste on the brush I could not believe his teeth became pearly white one to three quick yes of course there was some gum bleeding dislodging all that buildup I didn’t concern myself with that because I was seeing incredible results and in one sitting my dogs teeth went from black to white 123 quick
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Dog doesn't mind it, but does it work?
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have had some really smelly breaths so I decided to buy this gel. Good thing is, neither one of them mind the taste or smell! One of the actually gets excited when I pick up the tube! The downside is, I don't think its doing too well. Their breath still *kinda* stinks regardless of if we're brushing them or just letting them lick it. Not a big deal for me though, as it did minimize their stinky breath just not as much as I had hoped. I can see how that may be a concern for other buyers. Another note, I didn't buy the brush its simply not necessary for me as the dogs dont mind regular brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves the smell and taste, got rid of the bad breath.
customer_reviews.text: I never had success using any kind of toothpaste for my dogs and this one worked very well for my 16 months old maltipoo mix. Initial I bought those dental wipes to use because it is less invasive and my puppy seems to be ok with the wipes. But the dental wipes doesn’t get rid of his bad breath so I’m looking for the toothpaste soliton. I was afraid my puppy won’t like it but the minute I squeeze it out from the tub, he is already excited for it. The smell is pleasant and my puppy loves it. It also get rid of his bad breath and worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try it. 👏🏼
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying another product for years that’s very expensive. This product is in my budget. I’ve been brushing my dogs teeth with it and it works wonderfully. I’ve been buying another product for years that’s very expensive. This product is in my budget. I’ve been brushing my dogs teeth with it and it works wonderfully. I can attest to this because this is my third dog since 1993 and as I said I’ve use many products that were $$$$. This product works just as well why spend the extra money. I will definitely purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good teeth, happy puppy
customer_reviews.text: Have used it almost everyday at night for about a month. Definetly helps clean the plaque and tartar but didn't help the my dog's breath too much. More effective than other products I've tried for teeth. Would purchase again, one bottle will last me a very long time even with daily brushing
customer_reviews.author: pokedbz1691

customer_reviews.title: I think it gave my dogs the poops
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time before bed and my dog woke me up twice that night to go outside and had diarrhea, then a few loose stools all the next day. Also, the toothbrush design does not work well with the design of my dogs teeth and mouth. It doesn’t really wrap around them as well as I imagined it would.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna A.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love this toothbrush and toothpaste combo. All my dogs had booty breath and I brushed their teeth one time and it was gone, I was like what???? That's amazing! Gonna continue to use it, I'm hoping it will make the plaque they have go away so I'll keep updated on that later on. I'm currently doing it 3 times in a week and they actually like the taste of it so that's a bonus. Also love the toothbrush for it's easy usage, just got brush through as it hits the sides and bottom of their teeth all in one shot. I am amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Spread Love

customer_reviews.title: Poison!! Do not use
customer_reviews.text: After using this toothpaste for two days my dog ended up in the emergency room vomiting blood. It’s the only difference that she had in her life. This toothpaste cost me $900 and almost my dogs life
customer_reviews.author: Judi Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Effective treatment for dental health
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any dog parent. Sadly most vets won’t mention dental care. Of course not until it requires anesthesia and $400 later to scale the tarter off teeth. Maybe that’s why they don’t say a word? Anyway, like with anything new, especially something so foreign to your pup, start slow. Relax I’m the couch with pup on your lap or near by. Brush a little and stop. It will take time before they allow you to dive in and brush for a minute or so. Don’t stress the pup out or yourself. It can take 1-4 weeks before your pup is relaxed enough to allow a full mouth brushing.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It isn't minty, but it isn't meaty. Haha. It's a perfect mix. My dog likes the flavor and I don't mind the smell. He will lick it off of the tooth brush (which is one of the uses to freshen breath) and he lets me brush his teeth. With a tooth paste too minty I don't think we would have such an easy time. You also don't want one that smells like dog food because it won't help their breath! It is a great price and helps me remove plaque from his teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toothpaste!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed with this product! My dog is a senior & the vet told me to start brushing her teeth. Welllll.....I’ve had other dogs and the teeth brushing didn’t go so well. I got this toothpaste along with the brush and finger brush. At first my dog wanted nothing to do with it but I could see she really liked the taste. So after another try she sat still for the brushing. Now she doesn’t hesitate to allow me to brush her teeth!! I can’t say enough good things about yhis🙁
customer_reviews.author: lovetowalk

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: So this was my 1st time trying to brush my pups teeth; not an easy task. So I started 1st letting my pup Yoda taste the toothpaste then I took a couple of different brushes so he could see and feel it wouldn't hurt him. He danced around and it took a few tries but at one point I got to brush a few of his teeth. So there's potential and the toothpaste is clear and not sticky and didn't have an oder at Good luck dog owners but its a must to take care of ur pups teeth besides doggie dentists which can b costly
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Love

customer_reviews.title: It is toothpaste I think.
customer_reviews.text: Switched from C.E.T. toothpaste and noticed right away that this was NOT freshening my dogs breath. I started the C.E.T. toothpaste again and the dogs breath was instantly better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Simineri

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: My dogs breath smells like he ate a bag of turds! After using this it was much better, I gave the taste a 5 star since he didnt complain.... I didnt actually taste it myself. Its smelled great however. As for ease to use... well he is kinda a jerk so I gave that a one star but it's not their fault my dog doesn't like me ramming my phalanges in his mouth. Over all if your dog eats his or another animals turds then this will atleast cover up the smell while he licks the face of a person your not so fond of while you laugh inside
customer_reviews.author: Codey

customer_reviews.title: Has it's Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - It's odorless - It's relatively transparent (won't stain on carpet) - Really does get rid of bad breath Cons: - Kujo is not all that keen on the taste - it's more runny than your typical toothpaste so careful how you're pointing that toothbrush (as mentioned in pros, at least it doesn't stain carpet) - doesn't last super long or make his breath smell fresh/minty, it just kind of gets rid of the smell altogether until he licks something else
customer_reviews.author: BTV

customer_reviews.title: Doggo approved
customer_reviews.text: I go through a lot of dog toothpaste for my dogs as I brush their teeth daily. It’s weird but they demand toothbrushing. They really seem to like this flavour quite a bit. My issue is getting all of the paste out towards the end. Dog toothbrushes don’t lay flat and trying to squeeze paste out while holding the brush takes more coordination than I have. I kind of found a solution by squeezing it out onto the tray I use to hold their brushes and then dredging brushes through it.
customer_reviews.author: Jinxie

customer_reviews.title: Toothbrush is an odd shape
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd doesn't mind the taste of the toothpaste (at least that I can tell...) but the toothbrush itself is oddly shaped. I almost think a regular shaped toothbrush would be best because this toothbrush is hard to use. I feel like I'm just banging the plastic edges up against her teeth. With her big canines, its hard to get to the root of the tooth where all the plaque is because the tooth is so big and this toothbrush is just not conducive to this maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Banks

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It works as promised. Of course results may vary depending on how often you brush and how much you use the product. Not much of an odor, again user preference. I don't know how it taste and don't intend on investigating. I will say this, Libby( my rescue Pit) won't tolerate long brushing sessions. Unlikely that the toothpaste has anything to do with it. Just follow the directions on the tube and enjoy the bonding time with your dog. Would probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mjkilb

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job without upsetting my dog’s stomach
customer_reviews.text: The toothpaste doesn’t really smell of anything but it doesn’t upset my dog’s stomach. She used to loved another toothpaste that had a strong smell and that was more pasty, but that one made my dog have diarrhea. The toothbrush is good for bigger mouths and teeth. For my small Havanese it makes her gums bleed. So I don’t use the toothbrush. Overall, is a good product. I just wish it was more pasty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easier than anticipated/ dog enjoys flavor
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how this would work out but my small/medium dog has caught on fairly quickly to our new routine. He seems to enjoy the flavor of the toothpaste and will readily lick it off my finger. After 1 week/ 2 brushings, his breath was noticeably less offensive, and his teeth/ gums seemed to have a visible improvement. Contains glucose oxidase, a must for canine toothpaste. No offensive scent. The rest of the ingredients are natural. If your dog is skittish around the idea of the mouth being probed with a toothbrush, you can use your fingers for a few sessions to ease them into the routine comfortably. Bottom line. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny W

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomended
customer_reviews.text: While my dog doesn't seem to like the taste too much she doesn't absolutely hate it and the treat I give her after is a bonus. This toothpaste keeps my dogs breath fresher and hey teeth healthier. In the long run I'll keep buying these so she can keep her teeth as long as possible. I recommend buying this for your pup especially since you can brush their teeth yourself instead of taking them to a dentist all the time
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Marie

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 tubes. I started using 1 last Monday. After 1-wk,their breath is horrible. The other brand I was using there was No Bad Breath! It had completely cleared up,till I started using your product! They get their teeth brushed every nite! I'm disappointed I'm unable to get a refund. I didn't think it would cause their breath to get so bad. They have their teeth cleaned yearly so thats not the the cause. I just didn't think a refund wasn't possible after such a short period. I hope you'll reconsider & allow me a refund on these 2 tubes! Thank You,,,
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Carey

customer_reviews.title: First dog toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: This is the very first toothpaste we got for our dog. He doesn't have any serious dental issues and my choice was based on Amazon reviews only. Unfortunately, I have nothing to compare this toothpaste with. In general, helps to keep teeth clean, but it doesn't remove anything serious. I doesn't irritate my dog's mouth, however, I wish it could leave his breath fresher.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha and Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use. My dog is disgusted at the taste of it (could very well just be her but she like gags whenever I even brought it out) the toothbrush tool is very difficult to use and made her gums bleed. The finger attachment is easier to use but I don’t feel like does all that much. Used less than 5x before I threw out.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Extend your dog's life--Brush their teeth!
customer_reviews.text: I brush my dog's teeth religiously--because I believe in doing so it may help to add years to his life. This toothpaste is pleasant smelling and apparently pleasant tasting, because my dog licks his chops for a few minutes even after the brushing is over! It's thick enough to stay on the toothbrush and spreads easily over the dog's teeth.
customer_reviews.author: ARC

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and works well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a while now. I really love it because it is affordable and also because it doesn’t have a strong scent to it. A lot of other dog toothpaste are just too strong and stinks but this one isnt. My dog also has no issue with it. Not to mention that it doesn’t have all of those unnecessary additives and chemicals. I plan on using it until further notice. Affordable and works well T
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Good taste!
customer_reviews.text: My dog's favorite part of brushing her teeth is licking the gel. The gel has a light scent that freshens up my dog's mouth. Having in mind, my dog's mouth has a decently good odor but gets better with the gel. Brushing her teeth is not the easiest task but the rubber finger option makes it easier to maneuver around. Altho, the rubber option is too soft to get rid of hard material on the teeth. Overall, good taste and easy to use (use of treats helps with the compliance of the dog). This is also a regimen that will take your dog time to get accustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but I have seen no change in the tartar build up on my dog's teeth
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on my dogs teeth brushing around every other day and have noticed any change in the tartar build up on his teeth at all. I am assuming it's doing something on some level in keeping his teeth and gums healthy but visually nada.
customer_reviews.author: MD2009

customer_reviews.title: The buildup on her teeth is significantly better already! And she loves the taste
customer_reviews.text: We have an 8 year old pitbull and the vet wanted to clean her teeth. She's been through a lot of medical problems already and we didn't want to add another anesthesia. I bought this toothpaste based on the reviews, we are using it with "H&H Pets Professional Dog Finger Toothbrushes". We brushed her teeth every day for 2 weeks, then once every few days. The buildup on her teeth is significantly better already! And she loves the taste, she even licks it off the brush before we even get started.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps their teeth clean and breath fresh
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I’ve been using it for my dog for over a year now, dogs don’t object to the taste, and they do lick it off the toothbrush which I let them do to clean their tongue and then brush the outside of their teeth and it seems to keep them very clean. I also like that it is reasonably priced and haven’t noticed any side effects like diarrhea etc. that some people have said comes with certain toothpaste their dogs have eaten.
customer_reviews.author: Rottie fan 77

customer_reviews.title: Senior Dog Likes Taste of Toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I have a dachshund and because he is a soft mouth dog and is 14 years old I need to brush his teeth. He likes doggie toothpaste but this three sided toothbrush is just not working for him so I’m gonna have to get a regular doggy toothbrush. This brush will probably work well for a puppy as long as you start brushing its teeth early or a larger dog who is already used to having its teeth brushed.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaD

customer_reviews.title: Our 7 year old maltipoo seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - USA made toothpaste. - Comes with 2 different types of brushes: hand-held doggie toothbrush and a finger brush. They are both very doggie-friendly. - The scent seems to be okay. It doesn't seem to have a strong smell - My dog seems to be okay with it. No gagging noted. Cons: Nothing really. The price is very reasonable and the company seems big and reputable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Dogs go crazy for tooth brushings
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described. Both our dogs teeth are so shiny and white. The vet compliments them every visit. We have been using this for a year. My wife using a pea size for each dog(2 of them), and she brushes teeth about every day. They just love having it done and like the flavor, its like a treat. I do not know how it works, but the product removes and keeps off plaque. They always beg for a second brushing!
customer_reviews.author: David Wilson

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars for this great dog toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I give it 10 stars. I love it. My dog tolerates it. It is very pleasant, fresh and light. Easy to swallow. Not as pasty, sticky and bad smelling as other products. Thank you Amazon for your recommendation. It is the best toothpaste I ever had for my dog
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie

customer_reviews.title: Great for my picky chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: My 5 pound chihuahua is a picky eater, and because of that I have to feed her wet food. And now I have to brush her teeth to ensure I don't have thousands of dollars of vet bills down the road due to her expensive tastes. I have tried a couple other toothpastes and they are either filled with unnecessary chemicals or are completely undesirable by my dog. This is the only toothpaste she will let me use on her and I am so happy to have found something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Willow Hadleigh

customer_reviews.title: Dog Toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: My dog had brown spots on all her teeth. I have been using this toothpaste for 2 weeks and her teeth have come back white. I tried other toothpastes but it did not work. I recommend it highly. The results are impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Monique L

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves teeth time!
customer_reviews.text: Both dogs love this stuff! My husky always enjoyed getting his teeth brushed, but now he sees his toothbrush & goes nuts! I feel like the tarter on his teeth is slowly chipping away which makes me happy! Not sure why they love it so much it doesn’t even have a flavor.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Fresher breath in just 2 days of use, my dogs love this too.
customer_reviews.text: I used this TWO days on my dogs and could tell the BIGGEST difference in their breath. I've been using for several weeks and my dogs teeth are beginning to whiten...breath still fresh. Hope it gets rid of the plaque to avoid any dental cleaning. I have two dachshunds, one 10 and the other 7 so am TRYING to deal with the plaque NOW. I have tried MANY other things and they did not do anything. I have also tried to brush my dogs' teeth but they fight me. I started TRYING to do it as small pups....but they just do not like it. They don't mind this gel AT ALL. They think it's a TREAT.
customer_reviews.author: livelikeno2morrow

customer_reviews.title: Works !!
customer_reviews.text: Our MinPinChi likes this product - does not mind his teeth being brushed with it either Noticed significant difference when consistently used vs' when he forgets to brush his teeth (lol) Removes plaque - no longer inflamed around gum lines - no longer has bad breath
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Picky dogs may not like this
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think my dog was picky until I tried this toothpaste. My dog loves to eat anything, even lint on the ground. My dog loved my last toothpaste, which was a chicken flavored one by Sentry, but he doesn’t care for this one at all. It make brushing more difficult. Sigh. This also doesn’t seem to clean his teeth as well, but it could be because brushing is harder with this gel.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Z

customer_reviews.title: Useless toothpaste and no scent!
customer_reviews.text: My little dog has some stinky stinky breath. This did absolutely nothing for it. I brushed his teeth a few days in a row with this to see if it would help, but there was no results. I am going to end up going back to CET enzymatic toothpaste which worked wonders. At first I thought the tooth brush design was such a genius idea, but in practicality it does seem to be designed more for human teeth then for dogs. My dog does not like that brush
customer_reviews.author: Vizzy

customer_reviews.title: Vet’s Best Enzymatic Dog Toothpaste/Dental Care Gel
customer_reviews.text: Vet’s Best Enzymatic Dog Toothpaste/Dental Care Gel: Nice light gel. The vet recommended I start out "brushing" my dog's teeth with a piece of gauze over my finger. She's getting close to the age when she'll need more dental care if I don't keep her teeth clean. I added the toothpaste today, and she actually licked it off her teeth and looked at me for more! Next step, fingertip brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Zen Elder

product_meta.title: Vet’s Best Enzymatic Dog Toothpaste | Teeth Cleaning and Fresh Breath Dental Care Gel | Vet Formulated
product_meta.description: Style:ToothpasteSupport your dog’s dental hygiene between cleanings with Vet’s Best Enzymatic Dental Gel Toothpaste. Our veterinarian-formulated mix of key natural ingredients provide antibacterial and antifungal qualities that fight tartar and plaque, promote healthy gums and teeth, whiten and brighten your dog’s smile, and freshen her breath.
feature_bullets: SOOTHING AND EFFECTIVE - Vet’s Best Enzymatic Dental Gel Toothpaste is a veterinarian formulated soothing and effective mix of aloe, neem oil, grapefruit seed extract, baking soda, and enzymes
CLEANS AND FRESHENS - Freshens breath and gently cleans away plaque and tartar
PART OF A HEALTHY REGIMEN - Supports your dog’s dental hygiene between annual cleanings at your vet’s office
NATURAL FLAVORS - Your dog will love the great taste. You will love how it brightens and whitens teeth while freshening the breath
SAME FORMULA, NEW PACKAGE - The same great Vet’s Best dental gel is now available in an easy to use squeeze tube
